Hi there. If you want my opinion (and it is only my PERSONALLY - you should do whatever makes you happy here in game):

I would not choose Mammoth Bone. At low levels it seems not that bad, but the best brutes have only good solid weapons so when you accepted Mammoth Bone your brute automatically lost in my eyes... And this weapon does not really gain anything like brsword or knife do with some stats (weapons master, shield etc)
As for lance - lots of people like it a lot, I have tough time fighting it most times... but honestly I would also not choose this one... Not many great brutes have it and there are better weapons that work similar - like Trident. On the other hand - you have 6th sense and shield which work great with lance... So to sum up - it is not a fail but I would rate this weapon medium, not special.
Whip - avespme weapon, pitty that you get it after Mammoth Bone... if you have it - try getting multihitting skill, shock,

You should try path without accepting mammoth bone and see what will you get offered.
If you dont want to do that and be weaponsless for a few more levels - try branching destiny at the point: lance or dog or the double skills: Speed/Agi Endurance/Agi

You would do good with those weapons:
sai/flail/whip/trombone - avesome weapons in any build
broadsword - pretty common so if you see it - you can choose it
Frying pan - verry rare weapon - I got offered flail (3x) more than frying pan (1x) - but avesome blocker
shuriken - why not
Morning Star - a good weapon deals good damage is pretty quick for heavy weapons
Trident - much better choice than lance
Sword - 6th sense + shield = great combos!
And I PERSONALLY would decline any other weapon (as for your current skills - if you get more like weapons master or else - the list would be bigger...)

Demonology
People say they are a bit useless - because they make you dodge only first attack (for dodging in general is Untouchable - but it is rare).
And from my experience - if oponent has multihit weapon or/and high agi - you dodge first blow of multihit - but has normal chance of being hit all the next blows.

But I usually accept them anyways - because fierce brute is not too seldom activated in the first round - and you have 100% chance of dodging it

Also - if you have survival, resistant and ballet shoes - it takes at least 7 blows to actually kill you - and for someone with flail or axe that is amazing disadvantage

But if a fter ballet shoes I dont get anything worthy - I dont mind sacrificing that skill to branch my destiny there

Demonology
Feline Agility > Shock > Spd+3 > Fists of Fury > Agil+3 > Hatchet > Baton > Vitality > Lead Skeleton > Knife.
(I'm having mixed feelings about the knife, but what's done is done.)

Now, I've been offered the choice between Tamer and Endurance+3. I haven't seen Tamer activate very often... do you think it's worth it?

Well... I have few tamers. But pet brutes arent that common - so tamer is seldomly used. I think its activation is like bomb. It usually activates (if there are dead animals) but it also sometimes does not activate even if there are dead animals lying aroun.

And the hp gain is much higher than hp of pets. I have seen my oponent eating wolf and gaining +50HP or eating dog and gaining 25HP... With bear it was around 75HP (but then he maxed out - so I dont know if he would gain more)

If you have a few dogs yourself - then it is good. But if you are couning only on your oponent pets - I would go for endurance then.

Demonology
By level 12, you should have a maximum of 4 weapons of 6 GREAT weapons (Halberd, Flail, Sai, Trombone, Shuriken, Morning Star, Whip, Sword etc..)

Way too many weapons.

And you said from 6 great weapons and then you posted way more (and etc at the end of the list - so it is longer even than that)... that was somewhat confusing.

And if you get so many wepaons by lev 12 - they occupy the spots of good skills and stats (which are not useless).
If you get only one good weapon by the lev 10-12 -> it is ok too. And actually you can do great without any weapons if you have MA+HercStr or bear or wolf or thief.

At low levels are a lot of opponents who are "late bloomers" (they get all the good stuff on higher levels) - so you can find easy oponents. Dont go accepting all the weapons (even the ones considered "good", I am sure bumps is on lots of peoples good list too...). Try 1-2 and see if you have skills that make those wepaons be used better by your brute.
Remember that weapons are only means for your skills to trully shine. You can have average weapon - broadsword, lance - that will do great if you have certain skills that go with them.

I am not saying that you should decline fiali because You are below lev 10 and already have 2 weapons - just use your head and not blindly accept all hte weapons that people consider good just because. Skills play much more important role than wepoans.

On january 7, 2012
wangthu
Well the disarm chance is only 30%.

Most of the time when you have shock you knock out the weapon the next time you attack, so you are not gaining much.

More than a couple times I have attacked with knife then ironhead disarms it, then I multihit 2-3 times with fists and character dies. So you get the speed benefit of knife and the brutal damages of martial arts.

If they get disarmed theya re also more likely to pull another weapon. So say they attack with knife again and it gets disarmed. Then then run back, pull out flail, and finish you. Again this has happened with me as well, more than once.

So I don't think it's a great choice when you have shock. Maybe not an outright BAD choice but stats don't have any drawbacks.

On january 17, 2012
SoItBegins
The thing is with Shuriken is that it's kinda the antithesis of Flail. Flail is a big heavy weapon that works by flattening the opponent before they can lay hands on you. Shuriken is the death of a thousand cuts, where your opponent barely has time to get an attack in with all the stuff you're wanging at him.

Personally, I would go for Shuriken-- if you come across a brute with Thief or Sabotage, you might be hosed otherwise, but this'll give you an extra shot at the win.

~

On my end, I have a brute at Fist of Steel: she has STR 5, AGL 8, SPD 16, Health of 116, Baton, Axe, and Morning Star, and no skills. I've just been offered counter-attack, or END+3.
As it is, Counter-attack would be close to useless with my brute's current set of weapons; however, if she were to get shield down the road, it'd make her a real pain to tangle with.

What do you think? Gamble on Counterattack, or play it safe with the extra health?

On january 17, 2012
lucaswhit
alport, the advantage from spy is that you're able to scope out killer brutes before you waste a life in fighting them. if you have a brute early vs a wolf/bear brute you're probably not going to win unless a miracle happens.

same thing with shuriken brutes, there's nothing worse than fighting vs a shuriken brute early in a destiny without thief/shock/sabotage. you get 1-3 hits in while they get 100 stars thrown towards your gut.

the downside is that you have to spend 1 life per 24 hour period of using this skill. get your notepad program ready or pen and paper and research as many brutes on your level as possible. try and scope out all the brutes you can knock off, and go after them. with luck, you'll average more fights every day than what you have to spend to get spy.

On february 1, 2012
45424
Get broadsword only if you have (or are sure you'll get) shield, counter-attack and (optional but highly recommended) weapons master.

Get knife only if you have fist of fury, high agility and (optional) speed, weapons master.

Never get bumps (except with both relentless+determination, or relentless+6th sense).

Get hatchet only if you don't have a weapon at level 10 (and know you'll not get any weapon until level 15).

Get halberd only if you get 6th sense and (optional) weapons master.

Get shuriken only if that's your first weapon.

On february 5, 2012
Demonology
If you dont choose broadsword - you wont get the things that are in your destiny after broadsword.

So if you do the same choices up to the broadsword - you will get the same stuff as previous rank. But if you change anything - your choices will be all new.

((you still get the chance to get some of the things you had before, but it wont be in the same ordre, and that is only a chance - meaning you may get none of the things that you got after broadsword)).


Also forgot to tell you - dont take pets with your backup - they dont come to help with backup.

leaksville
othoboxy, you should take the knife. there is a strong chance every opening attack for you will be 2-3 weapons destroyed. the knife has an extremely high hit rate, and is a killer weapon vs feline agility, untouchable, shield, and resistant brutes. plus the knife works fast so almost every time you get an attack you'll follow with a 2nd before your opponent can react. you'll be a shuriken/flail killer especially if you're blessed with first strike.

the computer program is obviously going to keep offering knife until you take it. that means that you're likely missing out on additional skills and killer weapons that could have been in the knife's place.

consider this same destiny again next go around, and take the knife first chance you get.

p.s. the knife gives a speed bonus, so besides the endurance bonus of your vitality try and add lightning bolt or plain +3 speed here and there to boost your sabotage chances. i'd like to see what you're offered once you do get the knife.

On february 11, 2012
Demonology
It is not much difference

This game is really based much on luck, and that difference you posted may just be a coincidence.

Or you may havepreference in choosing oponents. For example me (if I dont use my spy) I always choose lowest HP oponents and (depending on my brute) low agi or low sth. If you have such preference (like you think agi and sp are useless - you choose oponents with high agi and sp and low hp and str) - one of your brutes may just perform better against such oponents And the other doesnt have the build to deal with those (like for baton I would choose speedy agile oponents with lowest HP, and average str)... ANd you may actually do that unintentionally (like subconsciously)

Also - on padawan it is really hard to "feel" the game. In higher ranks (like from fist of steel) - then you have more good builds and much better brute oponents (most bad ones either choose destiny and got sth good, or stopped playing or retired their bad brutes), and the brutes that were doing quite ok in lower ranks have real trouble... Believe me it happened to me quite a few times (like my sword + morning star brute which I though has much potential and I explored different paths only to learn for sure at blazing avenger that she is in fact crappier and crappier...).

On higher levels when you face armor, toughtened skins, flails (which apparently is verry susceptibile to shocking ability of baton ) MAs etc - you will see that your baton is not enough.
Also it is worth to mention that on padawan you seldomly meet a brute higher than lev4 without any weapon, even the crappy bumps. On higher ranks people wait for good stuff and dont take crap so you can easily meet lev7 without wepoan and sometimes lev9 - it will be easier to levelup if you too have to wait some time for a good weapon.

benwhitfield
3 strength then add herc. strength = 3 + 3 str= 6 , then multiply 6 x 1.5 = 9

if your strength had been 7, = 7 + 3 = 10, then 10 x 1.5 = 15

wangthu
yeah I know people think thief is great, but then people think lots of stupid stuff is great or unbeatable and they whine about it at great length.

Shock is better than sabotage or thief by a long shot. It gives you a good chance against anything. If you survive inital attack you will almost always manage to disarm it on your turn.

With thief you can steal really retarded stuff, and at higher levels you are only making it more likely you get killed. Think about it, everyone has multiple weapons and you won't run them down with thief. What you are doing is maximizing the chance they get to use each weapon. Instead of wasting all their time using their less powerful weapons they get a chance to use all of them at least once before you steal it.

So you take away their knife then they pull their flail and kill you. Wow that worked out great. If a guy has flail and sword you just guaranteed they get to use it at least once before you steal it. Which is pretty much a death sentence.

And worse the weapon great for that guy might be crap for you. If you have no speed or determination and steal club you are out of luck and will just sit there being killed.

In fact I can't even remember the last time I lost to someone due to thief it just never happens. The only people vulnerable to it are guys who have just one weapon.

Sabotage is better than thief but it's only really useful if you can run the guy out of weapons. Sometimes you just get rid of his crap weapons then he kills you.

It's not just the tokens but competition. At lower levels now things are much harder now. The reason is that mediocre brutes have trouble ranking up so they get to high levels before they go. Supercharged brutes whiz right past them. But the guys in between who have good but not OP brutes have trouble against a guy who's 30th level when they are 15th level because stats add up over time. Once I broke out of blazing avenger things got much easier on me.

Once people got ahead the tendency is to stay ahead. I mean muckPL had like 40-50 levels by the time there was enough people for a tournament on some ranks. Doesn't matter how good their brutes were all but 2-3 guys were just too far behind in levels to ever come any closer.
On february 22, 2012
wangthu
So whatever could make you jump ahead early on meant you would pretty much always be ahead.

On march 1, 2012
leaksville
so it begins, it really depends on what brute you want, and what skills you have besides the ones listed.

i like the combo of shield and scimitar. it's a nasty multihit and counter build. WM, counter-attack, hostility, are going to put you toe to toe with a lot of brutes. feline agility, fist of fury are also killer skills to have with that. you can add a weapon killer at any time and get about the same impact as sai, plus your brute won't throw the scimitar as fast as sai.

sai is great against flails and shurikens. it's terrible against 6th sense and counter brutes. if your brute has sabotage and speed it makes sense to grab it. i like knife+shock+WM personally and think that a brute going in this direction will end up stronger in the levels 20+

On march 4, 2012
benwhitfield
Terbutalin, strongly consider forking destiny after you pick up hammer. also, consider only taking +3 stat power ups instead of +2 agility +1 endurance (etc). i have changed destiny trees before with this subtle modification, and i've noticed significantly better skills/weapons are offered when i take +3 point offerings. hammer is a rare skill, it can't be missed, and it evolves with your brute unlike bombs. the more strength you take the higher the 400% damage. this can save you from bears and most brutes (except resistant)

indiana jones you need to take the noodle bowl. you have MA, you have feline agility. you can likely have noodle bowl as your sole weapon until level 20, and instead of weapons you'll be gaining agility +4-5 points an upgrade, you'll gain +3 strength a few times to boost your MA, you'll have additional speed to throw additional bowls. feline agility will make your noodle/karate fighter dodge and throw for 12-16 points per bowl, and then it will go up every time you gain agility .

had a whip/noodle bowl brute on furious soul. he level'ed up at 22. speed and agility are important. i'm on the same destiny but i have recently branched it at level 8, i took fierce brute then and may have delayed my noodle bowl since last time i passed on FB and took agility, then i was awarded noodles on level 10. on level 9 i took weapons master. i'm happy with the changes but i'll miss the noodles

On march 12, 2012
benwhitfield
raze post your skills, stats, level.

that being said, 95% of time you need to take counter-attack. it's the best defense against multi-hitting brutes. if you gain shield, you're going to have a 55% chance to block and counter attack (45% chance from shield to block and a 10% chance to block from counter). although your counter-attack isn't going to be a 100% guaranteed hit, you'll immediately stop your opponent's attack. the higher you go in levels, the higher the opponent's agility, so multi-hits are more frequent.

imagine stacking counter with shield and shock or sabotage. that will give you a valuable attack that may destroy an opponent's flail/sword/axe/sai/trombone/mug/trident .

lucaswhit
dog takes away health from your brute, but may absorb fierce brute, hammer skill, flail hit, and the net. that would give you an extra chance to shock your opponent.

you'll also be taking away +3 speed from your fist of fury/knife brute. i'm not a big fan of dogs, especially once you get to the low 20's levels. dogs seem to work best with a wolf or bear. to me, you're giving up too much for a separate 14 hp with little extra offense.
